summary: This is a U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General forensic examination report analyzing two BOP-owned computers from the Metropolitan Correctional Center's Special Housing Unit where Jeffrey Epstein was housed. The report details the request to examine user activity on the devices around the time of Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Carpenter
persons.context: Submitted the digital forensics examination request and arranged for seizure of the devices from the MCC. Requested analysis of user activity timelines.

persons.name: David Epstein
persons.context: Former inmate housed in the MCC Special Housing Unit who died by suicide on August 10, 2019. The forensic examination was initiated due to his death.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: Reported to have used Device 1 during the relevant time frame around Epstein's death.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Reported to have used Device 2 during the relevant time frame around Epstein's death.

persons.name: Leonard
persons.context: Received and forensically analyzed Devices 1 and 2, created a timeline of user activity, and generated an Excel spreadsheet with the findings.

connections.description: Thomas was a BOP staff member at the facility where Epstein was housed as an inmate.
Noel was a BOP correctional officer at the facility where Epstein was housed as an inmate.
Both are OIG personnel involved in the forensic examination; Carpenter requested the analysis and Leonard conducted it.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide while housed in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

events.title: Forensic Examination Request and Analysis
events.description: The OIG New York Field Office submitted a request for forensic analysis of two BOP computers from Epstein's housing unit, and Leonard began the examination.

locations: Federal Bureau of Prisons, Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The forensic examination was initiated following Jeffrey Epstein's suicide on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
Two BOP-owned computers (Devices 1 and 2) were seized from the Special Housing Unit where Epstein was housed.
Device 1 was reportedly used by BOP Materials Handler Supervisor Michael Thomas, and Device 2 by BOP Correctional Officer Tova Noel during the relevant timeframe.
The analysis aimed to determine user activity and attribution on these devices prior to, at the time of, and after the discovery of Epstein's body.
The report is classified as 'SENSITIVE BUT UNCLASSIFIED' and details the forensic procedures and chain of custody.
